meanings.definition: Prepacks (verb): to package or arrange items in advance
meanings.sent1: She prepacks her lunch every night before school.
meanings.sent2: The company prepacks the products for easy shipping.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could prepacks his entire wardrobe for the trip in just one suitcase.
meanings.sent4: Her mind prepacks all the tasks she needs to do for the day like neatly folded clothes in a suitcase.
meanings.sent5: The idea of prepacks makes the process of getting ready for the trip much simpler.

meanings.definition: Prepacks (noun): items that have been packaged or arranged in advance
meanings.sent1: The store sells prepacks of snacks for convenience.
meanings.sent2: She bought prepacks of stationery for the new school year.
meanings.sent3: The prepacks of cookies on the shelf tempted him with their delicious aroma.
meanings.sent4: The prepacks of memories in her mind brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent5: The prepacks of supplies made the camping trip much easier to prepare for.
